original: catuṣpariṣat sūtram
analyzed: catuṣpariṣad sūtram
translated: The Sutra of the Four Assemblies

original: bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyāṃ vihāraṃ nadyā nairañjanāyāstīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam anuyuktoviharati
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyām vihāram nadyāḥ nairañjanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: The Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, was dwelling in a monastery on the bank of the Nairañjanā River, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, constantly practicing, mindful, devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening.

original: sa rātryāḥ prathame yāme ṛddhiviṣayajñānasākṣīkriyāyā abhijñāyāṃ cittaṃ abhinirnāmayatyanekavidham ṛddhiviṣayaṃ pratyanubhavati /🔽tadyathā eko bhūtvā bahudhā bhavati /
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ prathame yāme ṛddhi viṣaya jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ abhijñāyām cittam abhinirnāmayati anekavidham ṛddhi viṣayam pratyanubhavati  tat yathā ekaḥ bhūtvā bahudhā bhavati
translated: In the first watch of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the supernormal knowledge of the range of supernormal power, and experienced various kinds of supernormal power:🔽having been one, he became many;

original: bahudhā bhūtvā eko bhavati /
analyzed: bahudhā bhūtvā ekaḥ bhavati
translated: having been many, he became one;

original: āvirbhavati tirobhāvaṃ jñānadarśanena pratyanubhavati /🔽tiraskuḍyaṃ tiraḥśailaṃ tiraḥprākāram asajyamānaḥ kāyena gacchati tadyathā ākāśe pṛthivyām unmajjananimajjanaṃ karoti tadyathā udake /🔽udake asajyamānaḥ kāyena gacchati tadyathā pṛthivyām /
analyzed: āvirbhavati tirobhāvam jñāna darśanena pratyanubhavati  tiraskuḍyam tiras śailam tiras prākāram a sajyamānaḥ kāyena gacchati tat yathā ākāśe pṛthivyām unmajjana nimajjanam karoti tat yathā udake  udake a sajyamānaḥ kāyena gacchati tat yathā pṛthivyām
translated: he became visible, invisible;🔽he went unhindered through walls, through enclosures, through mountains, as if through space; he dived in and out of the earth as if in water; he walked on water without sinking as if on earth;

original: ākāśe paryaṃgena vikramate tadyathā pakṣi śakuniḥ /
analyzed: ākāśe paryaṃgena vikramate tat yathā pakṣi śakuniḥ
translated: he flew cross-legged through the sky like a bird with wings;

original: imāvapi candrasūryau evaṃ mahardhikau evaṃ mahānubhāvau pāṇinā āmārjati parimārjayati yāvad brahmalokādapi kāyena vaśe vartayati /
analyzed: imau api candra sūryau evam mahardhikau evam mahā anubhāvau pāṇinā āmārjati parimārjayati yāvat brahma lokāt api kāyena vaśe vartayati
translated: And he touches with his hand, strokes, and even goes up to the world of Brahmā with his body, these two, the moon and the sun, which have such great power and such great majesty.

original: iti bodhisattvo bhagavān uruvilvāyāṃ viharaṃ nadyā nairañjanāyāstīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipākṣikeṣū dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam
analyzed: iti bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān uruvilvāyām viharam nadyāḥ nairañjanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam
translated: Thus the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, while dwelling in Urubilvā on the banks of the Nairañjanā River, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, persevering, mindful, and fully aware, applied himself to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening.

original: anuyukto viharaṃ rātryāḥ prathame yāme anekavidham ṛddhiviṣayaṃ pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: anuyuktaḥ viharam rātryāḥ prathame yāme anekavidham ṛddhi viṣayam pratyanubhavati
translated: While dwelling thus, in the first watch of the night, he experienced various kinds of supernormal power.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān uruvilvāyāṃ viharaṃ pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān uruvilvāyām viharam pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, while dwelling in Urubilvā as before, applied himself.

original: sa rātryāḥ prathame yāme pūrvenivāsānusmṛtijñānasākṣīkriyāyā abhijñāyāṃ cittam abhinirnāmayati so'nekavidhaṃ pūrvenivāsaṃsamanusmarati
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ prathame yāme pūrvenivāsa anusmṛti jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ abhijñāyām cittam abhinirnāmayati saḥ u nekavidham pūrvenivāsam samanusmarati
translated: In the first watch of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the supernormal knowledge of recollecting past lives. He remembered various kinds of past lives,

original: tadyathaikāṃ jātiṃ dve tisraścatasraḥ yāvad anekānapi saṃvartakalpān samanusmarati /
analyzed: tat yathā ekām jātim dve tisraḥ catasraḥ yāvat anekān api saṃvarta kalpān samanusmarati
translated: such as one birth, two, three, four, up to many eons of world dissolution.

original: iti bodhisattvo bhagavāṃ uruvilvāyāṃ viharaṃ nadyā nairañjanāyāstīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam
analyzed: iti bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān uruvilvāyām viharam nadyāḥ nairañjanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam
translated: Thus the Bodhisattva, the Blessed One, dwelling in Urubilvā on the bank of the Nairañjanā River at the foot of the Bodhi tree, constantly diligent, discerning, devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening,

original: anuyukto viharaṃ rātryāḥ prathame yāme pūrvenivāsaṃ samanusmarati /
analyzed: anuyuktaḥ viharam rātryāḥ prathame yāme pūrvenivāsam samanusmarati
translated: dwelling diligently, in the first watch of the night, recollects his former abodes.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān uruvilvāyāṃ viharaṃ pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān uruvilvāyām viharam pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, the Blessed One, dwelling in Urubilvā as before, up to devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening,

original: sa rātryā madhyame yāme divyaśrotrajñānasākṣīkriyāyā abhijñāyāṃ cittam abhinirnāmayati divyena śrotreṇa viśuddhenātikrāṃtamānuṣeṇaubhayām
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ madhyame yāme divya śrotra jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ abhijñāyām cittam abhinirnāmayati divyena śrotreṇa viśuddhena atikrāṃta mānuṣeṇa aubhayām
translated: in the middle watch of the night directs his mind to the realization of the supernormal knowledge of the divine ear. With the divine ear, which is purified and surpasses the human, he

original: śṛṇoti mānuṣāṃśca ye vā dūre ye vāntike /
analyzed: śṛṇoti mānuṣān ca ye vā dūre ye vā antike
translated: hears both kinds of sounds, divine and human, whether far or near.

original: iti bodhisattvo bhagavān uruvilvāyāṃ viharaṃ nadyā nairañjanāyāstīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam
analyzed: iti bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān uruvilvāyām viharam nadyāḥ nairañjanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam
translated: Thus the Bodhisattva, the Blessed One, dwelling in Urubilvā on the bank of the Nairañjanā River at the foot of the Bodhi tree, constantly diligent, discerning, devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening,

original: anuyukto viharaṃ rātryā madhyame yāme divyaśrotrajñānaṃ pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: anuyuktaḥ viharam rātryāḥ madhyame yāme divya śrotra jñānam pratyanubhavati
translated: dwelling diligently, in the middle watch of the night experiences the divine ear knowledge.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān uruvilvāyāṃ viharaṃ pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān uruvilvāyām viharam pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, dwelling in Urubilvā, as before, up to dwelling in seclusion.

original: sa rātryā madhyame yāme divyacakṣurjñānasākṣīkriyāyā vidyāyāṃ cittam abhinirnāmayati /
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ madhyame yāme divya cakṣuḥ jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ vidyāyām cittam abhinirnāmayati
translated: In the middle watch of the night, he directs his mind to the knowledge and insight of the divine eye.

original: divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhenātikrāntamānuṣeṇa sattvān paśyati cyavamānānapyupapadyamānānapi suvarṇānapi durvarṇānapi hīnānapi praṇītānapi
analyzed: divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhena atikrānta mānuṣeṇa sattvān paśyati cyavamānān api upapadyamānān api suvarṇān api durvarṇān api hīnān api praṇītān api
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate,

original: sugatimapi gacchato durgatimapi yathākarmopagān sattvān yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sugatim api gacchataḥ durgatim api yathā karma upagān sattvān yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: and he understands how beings pass on according to their actions.🔽These beings, friends, who are endowed with bodily misconduct, verbal and mental misconduct, who revile the noble ones, have wrong views and take up actions based on wrong views,

original: itīme bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāyaduścaritena samanvāgatā vāṅmanoduścaritena samanvāgatā āryāṇām apavādakā mithyādṛṣṭayo mithyādṛṣṭikarmadharmasamādānahetostaddhetostatpratyayaṃ
analyzed: iti ime bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāya duścaritena samanvāgatāḥ vāc manaḥ duścaritena samanvāgatāḥ āryāṇām apavādakāḥ mithyādṛṣṭayaḥ mithyādṛṣṭi karma dharma samādāna hetoḥ tad hetoḥ tad pratyayam
translated: because of that cause, because of that reason, due to that cause, due to that condition,

original: kāyasya bhedāt paraṃ maraṇād apāyadurgativinipātam narakeṣūpapadyante /
analyzed: kāyasya bhedāt param maraṇāt apāya durgati vinipātam narakeṣu upapadyante
translated: after the break-up of the body, after death, fall into a bad realm of existence, into an unfortunate state, into hell.

original: ime vā punarbhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāyasucaritena samanvāgatā vāṅmanaḥsucaritena samanvāgatā āryāṇām anapavādakāḥ samyagdṛṣṭayaḥ samyagdṛṣṭikarmadharmasamādānahetostaddhetostatpratyayaṃ
analyzed: ime vā punar bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāya su caritena samanvāgatāḥ vāc manaḥ su caritena samanvāgatāḥ āryāṇām anapavādakāḥ samyak dṛṣṭayaḥ samyak dṛṣṭi karma dharma samādāna hetoḥ tad hetoḥ tad pratyayam
translated: Or, these beings, endowed with good bodily conduct, endowed with good verbal and mental conduct, not disparaging the noble ones, having right view, due to undertaking actions and dharmas with right view, by that cause, by that condition,

original: kāyasya bhedāt sugatau svargaloke deveṣūpapadyante /
analyzed: kāyasya bhedāt sugatau svarga loke deveṣu upapadyante
translated: after the break-up of the body, are reborn in a good realm, in heaven, among the gods.

original: iti bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyāṃ viharaṃ nadyā nairaṃjanāyāstire bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogama
analyzed: iti bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyām viharam nadyāḥ nairaṃjanāyāḥ tire bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogama
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, dwelling in Urubilvā on the bank of the Nairañjanā River at the foot of the Bodhi tree, constantly practicing, being careful, dwelling engaged in the yoga of meditation on the dharmas that are factors of enlightenment,

original: anuyukto viharaṃ rātryā madhyame yāme divyacakṣurjñānaṃ pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: anuyuktaḥ viharam rātryā madhyame yāme divya cakṣuḥ jñānam pratyanubhavati
translated: in the middle watch of the night, experiences the knowledge of the divine eye.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyāṃ viharaṃ pūrvavad yavad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyām viharam pūrvavat yavat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then, the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, dwelling in Urubilvā as before, up to dwelling engaged [in meditation],

original: sa rātryā paścime yāme cetaḥparyāyajñasākṣikriyāya abhijñāyam cittam abhinirnāmayati /
analyzed: sa rātryā paścime yāme cetaḥ paryāya jña sākṣi kriyāya abhijñāyam cittam abhinirnāmayati
translated: in the last watch of the night, directs his mind to the realization of the knowledge of the bases of psychic power.

original: parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānaṃ vitarkitaṃ vicaritaṃ manasā mānasaṃ yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: para sattvānām para pudgalānam vitarkitam vicaritam manasā mānasam yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the thought and mental activity of other beings and persons, of those with thought and mental activity.

original: sarāgacittaṃ sarāgaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sa rāga cittam sa rāgam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it really is a mind with passion as a mind with passion,

original: vigatarāgaṃ vigatarāgaṃ iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /🔽sadveṣaṃ vigatadveṣaṃ samoham vigatamohaṃ vikṣiptaṃ saṃkṣiptaṃ līnaṃ pragṛhitam
analyzed: vigata rāgam vigata rāgam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti  sa dveṣam vigata dveṣam sa moham vigata moham vikṣiptam saṃkṣiptam līnam pragṛhitam
translated: and a mind without passion as a mind without passion.🔽He knows as it really is a mind with hatred as a mind with hatred, a mind without hatred as a mind without hatred, a mind with delusion as a mind with delusion, a mind without delusion as a mind without delusion, a contracted mind as contracted, a distracted mind as distracted,🔽an exalted mind as exalted, an unexalted mind as unexalted, an unexhausted mind as unexhausted, an exhausted mind as exhausted,

original: uddhataṃ anuddhataṃ avyupaśāntaṃ vyupaśantaṃ samāhitaṃ asamāhitam abhāvitaṃ bhāvitaṃ avimuktaṃ cittam avimuktaṃ cittaṃ iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti
analyzed: uddhatam an uddhatam a vyupaśāntam vyupaśantam samāhitam a samāhitam a bhāvitam bhāvitam a vimuktam cittam a vimuktam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: an unreleased mind as an unreleased mind.

original: iti bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyāṃ viharaṃ nadyā nairaṃjanāyāstire bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam
analyzed: iti bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyām viharam nadyāḥ nairaṃjanāyāḥ tire bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam
translated: Thus, the Blessed Bodhisattva, dwelling in Urubilvā on the bank of the Nairañjanā River at the foot of the Bodhi tree, continuously, carefully, and diligently practicing the meditation on the factors of awakening,

original: anuyukto viharaṃ rātryāḥ paścime yāmecetaḥparyāyajñānaṃ pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: anuyuktaḥ viharam rātryāḥ paścime yāme cetaḥ paryāya jñānam pratyanubhavati
translated: in the last watch of the night experienced the knowledge of the discernment of the mind.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyāṃ viharaṃ pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyām viharam pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then, the Blessed Bodhisattva, dwelling in Urubilvā as before, up to diligently practicing,

original: sa rātryāḥ paścime yāme āsravakṣayajñānasākṣikriyāyā abhijñāyāṃ cittam abhinirnāmayati /
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ paścime yāme āsrava kṣaya jñāna sākṣi kriyāyāḥ abhijñāyām cittam abhinirnāmayati
translated: In the last watch of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements, and to the realization of the supernormal knowledge.

original: idaṃ duḥkham āryasatyam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /🔽ayaṃ duḥkhasamudayaḥ /
analyzed: idam duḥkham ārya satyam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti  ayam duḥkha samudayaḥ
translated: He knew as it really is: 'This is the noble truth of suffering.'🔽This is the noble truth of the arising of suffering.

original: ayaṃ duḥkhanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: ayam duḥkha nirodhaḥ
translated: This is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: iyaṃ duḥkhannirodhagāminī pratipad āryasatyam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: iyam duḥkhan nirodha gāminī pratipad ārya satyam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: This is the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.'

original: tasyaivaṃ jānata evaṃ paśyataḥ kāmāsravāccittaṃ vimucyate /
analyzed: tasya evam jānataḥ evam paśyataḥ kāma āsravāt cittam vimucyate
translated: For him, knowing thus, seeing thus, his mind was liberated from the defilement of sensuality,

original: bhavāsravād avidyāsravāccittaṃ vimucyate /
analyzed: bhava āsravāt avidyā āsravāt cittam vimucyate
translated: from the defilement of becoming, from the defilement of ignorance.

original: vimuktasya vimukto'smiīti jñānadarśanaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: vimuktasya vimuktaḥ asmi iti jñāna darśanam bhavati
translated: When it was liberated, there was the knowledge: 'It is liberated.'

original: kṣīṇā me jātiruṣitaṃ brahmacaryaṃ kṛtaṃ karaṇīyaṃ nāparam asmād bhavaṃ prajānāmīti /
analyzed: kṣīṇā me jātiḥ uṣitam brahmacaryam kṛtam karaṇīyam na aparam asmāt bhavam prajānāmi iti
translated: He knew: 'Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.'

original: iti bhagavān urubilvayāṃ viharaṃ nadyā nairaṃjanāyāstīre bodhimūle kṛtakṛtyaḥ kṛtakaraṇīyaḥ saṃbuddhabodhis tejodhātuṃ samapannaḥ /
analyzed: iti bhagavān urubilvayām viharam nadyāḥ nairaṃjanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle kṛtakṛtyaḥ kṛta karaṇīyaḥ saṃbuddha bodhiḥ tejaḥ dhātum samapannaḥ
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, dwelling at Uruvilvā on the bank of the river Nairañjanā, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, having attained his goal and accomplished his task, the Fully Enlightened One entered into the fire element.
